pykomodo

API Reference

PyKomodo provides several modules for document processing, chunking, and management.

Table of Contents

  • Core Module

  • Multi-Directory Chunker

  • Enhanced Chunker

  • Command Line Interface

  • Configuration

Core Module

class pykomodo.core.PriorityRule[source]

Bases: object

Simple Python container for (pattern, score).

__init__(pattern, score)[source]
class pykomodo.core.PyCConfig[source]

Bases: object

A pure Python equivalent of the ‘PyCConfig’ that in Cython wrapped the ‘CConfig’ struct. This class maintains the same conceptual fields but in Pythonic form (lists, strings, booleans).

__init__()[source]
add_ignore_pattern(pattern)[source]

Just appends to a Python list.

Parameters:

pattern (str)

Return type:

None

calculate_priority(path)[source]

Returns the highest score among any matching priority rule.

Parameters:

path (str)

Return type:

int

count_tokens(text)[source]

Replicates py_count_tokens: Simple whitespace-based token counting in pure Python.

Parameters:

text (str)

Return type:

int

is_binary_file(path)[source]

  1. If extension is in self.binary_exts -> True

  2. Else read up to 512 bytes, if it has a null byte -> True

  3. If can’t open -> True

Parameters:

path (str)

Return type:

bool

make_c_string(text)[source]
Parameters:

text (str | None)

Return type:

str

read_file_contents(path)[source]

Reads the entire file as text, returns it. If can’t open, return “<NULL>” or handle differently.

Parameters:

path (str)

Return type:

str

should_ignore(path)[source]

Return True if path matches one of the ignore_patterns, unless it matches unignore_patterns first.

Parameters:

path (str)

Return type:

bool

Example usage:

from pykomodo.core import TextProcessor

processor = TextProcessor()
result = processor.process_text(my_document)

process_directory(directory)[source]
process_file(file_path, custom_chunk_size=None, force_process=False)[source]

Process a single file and create chunks from it.

Parameters:

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file to process

  • custom_chunk_size (int | None) – Optional custom chunk size for this specific file, overriding the global setting

  • force_process (bool) – If True, process the file even if it would normally be ignored

Return type:

None

should_ignore_file(path)[source]
class pykomodo.multi_dirs_chunker.PriorityRule[source]

Bases: object

__init__(pattern, score)[source]

Example usage:

from pykomodo.multi_dirs_chunker import MultiDirChunker

chunker = MultiDirChunker()
chunks = chunker.chunk_directories(['path/to/dir1', 'path/to/dir2'], chunk_size=1000)

Configuration

class pykomodo.pykomodo_config.KomodoConfig[source]

Bases: BaseModel

A Pydantic model representing pykomodo settings.

context_window: int
directories: List[str]
enhanced: bool
equal_chunks: int | None
extract_metadata: bool
max_chunk_size: int | None
min_relevance_score: float
model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

output_dir: str
remove_redundancy: bool
semantic_chunking: bool
pykomodo.pykomodo_config.run_chunker_with_config(config)[source]

Build and run a pykomodo chunker (Enhanced or basic) from config.

Parameters:

config (KomodoConfig)

Example configuration:

from pykomodo.pykomodo_config import PyKomodoConfig

config = PyKomodoConfig()
config.load_config('config.yaml')
